cab.content: (P 4383) From Secretary of State to Viceroy, Foreign Department,mh July 1919.Foreign Secret. Afghanistan. Your telegram No. 1101/6 of 29th instant. You t are authorised to instruct Grant in the sense proposed. His Majesty's Government, as you are aware, have no desire to resume hostilities, but they rely on you to see that our patience is not abused, and, on the other hand, to choose the best moment, politically and militarily, for resumption if Afghan attitude leaves no alternative.
